intro: Cyclosorus gymnopteridifrons, commonly known as the naked-winged cyclosorus, is a rare and lesser-known fern species. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures are concealed within small, specialized spore cases. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
